action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: starting out with a diverse set of letters including common vowels and consonants to maximize letter coverage
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = guava
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<green> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<green> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" is confirmed in the third position and letters "c", "r", "n", "e" are not in the word; trying "blast" to test new letters while keeping "a" in the correct spot.
guess: blast

attempts = 2
target_word = guava
guess = blast
guess_feedback = b<red> l<red> a<green> s<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> l<red> a<green> s<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback confirmed "a" in the third position; letters b, l, s, and t are not in the word. "foamy" tests new letters (f, o, m, y) while keeping "a" as the third letter.
guess: foamy

attempts = 3
target_word = guava
guess = foamy
guess_feedback = f<red> o<red> a<green> m<red> y<red>

guess_feedback: f<red> o<red> a<green> m<red> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" is confirmed in the third position; letters c, r, b, l, s, t, f, o, m, and y are excluded. "khadi" uses all new letters and places "a" correctly.
guess: khadi

attempts = 4
target_word = guava
guess = khadi
guess_feedback = k<red> h<red> a<green> d<red> i<red>

guess_feedback: k<red> h<red> a<green> d<red> i<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" is confirmed in the third position and many letters have been eliminated; opting for "guava" as it places "a" correctly and tests new letters (g, u, v) while accommodating a potential second "a".
guess: guava

attempts = 5
target_word = guava
guess = guava
guess_feedback = g<green> u<green> a<green> v<green> a<green>

guess_explanation: starting out with a diverse set of letters including common vowels and consonants to maximize letter coverage
"a" is confirmed in the third position and letters "c", "r", "n", "e" are not in the word; trying "blast" to test new letters while keeping "a" in the correct spot.
The feedback confirmed "a" in the third position; letters b, l, s, and t are not in the word. "foamy" tests new letters (f, o, m, y) while keeping "a" as the third letter.
"a" is confirmed in the third position; letters c, r, b, l, s, t, f, o, m, and y are excluded. "khadi" uses all new letters and places "a" correctly.
"a" is confirmed in the third position and many letters have been eliminated; opting for "guava" as it places "a" correctly and tests new letters (g, u, v) while accommodating a potential second "a".
